DataElement.preferredName: EORTC QLQ-H&N35 Version 1.0 57 Extent During Past Week Have Trouble Going out in Public Score 4 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A person's stated perception of the extent to which they have experienced trouble going out in public during the past week, using a four point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: European Organization for Research and Treatment of Cancer Quality of Life Questionnaire - Head & Neck 35 During Past Week Extent Have Trouble Going out in Public Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A group with aims to conduct, develop, coordinate, and stimulate laboratory and clinical research in Europe to improve the management of cancer and related problems by increasing survival but also patients' quality of life. There are more than 60 institutions and departments that have been recognized by EORTC as affiliated. These groups conduct, on a voluntary basis, laboratory research and/or clinical trials on all types of cancers using a multidisciplinary approach. EORTC maintains close working relationship with NCI and the British Cancer Research United Kingdom in London._A questionnaire developed by the European Organisation for Research and Treatment of Cancer (EORTC) consisting of 35 questions designed to assess quality of life in head and neck cancer patients._At some point in a given period of time._The most recent week, including today._A question about the extent to which an individual has or had trouble going out in public._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

These groups conduct, on a voluntary basis, laboratory research and/or clinical trials on all types of cancers using a multidisciplinary approach. EORTC maintains close working relationship with NCI and the British Cancer Research United Kingdom in London.:A questionnaire developed by the European Organisation for Research and Treatment of Cancer (EORTC) consisting of 35 questions designed to assess quality of life in head and neck cancer patients.

Concepts.longName: European Organization for Research and Treatment of Cancer
Concepts.definition: A group with aims to conduct, develop, coordinate, and stimulate laboratory and clinical research in Europe to improve the management of cancer and related problems by increasing survival but also patients' quality of life. There are more than 60 institutions and departments that have been recognized by EORTC as affiliated. These groups conduct, on a voluntary basis, laboratory research and/or clinical trials on all types of cancers using a multidisciplinary approach. EORTC maintains close working relationship with NCI and the British Cancer Research United Kingdom in London.

Concepts.longName: Quality of Life Questionnaire - Head & Neck 35
Concepts.definition: A questionnaire developed by the European Organisation for Research and Treatment of Cancer (EORTC) consisting of 35 questions designed to assess quality of life in head and neck cancer patients.

Concepts.definition: At some point in a given period of time.
The most recent week. May include the present day.

Concepts.longName: Extent Have Trouble Going out in Public
Concepts.definition: A question about the extent to which an individual has or had trouble going out in public.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ClassificationSchemes.longName: Quality of Life Measures (Patient Reported Outcomes - Health Related Quality of Life)

ReferenceDocuments.name: Have you had trouble going ou
ReferenceDocuments.description: Have you had trouble going out in public?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Using PRO/HRQoL Measures
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is part of a full set of items that comprise a PRO/HRQoL measure. The full set must be used without any changes to the questions or value set in order to retain the validity and reliability associated with the measure. The URL citation is provided so that caDSR users can obtain materials related to instructions for administering and/or scoring the measure. Changes may not be made to these documents. In cases where retaining the question set intact to preserve the validity and reliability are not as important as advancing the science, questions may be used individually or in combination with other measure questions.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Medidata ePRO CDE
ReferenceDocuments.description: This CDE has been validated for use with the Medidata Rave ePRO module.
